result.execSummary:
The defendant Pamela Shead was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.82(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report by 11/6/2015 at 3:00 p.m.
Straight time.  Court will allow defendant to serve sentence on consecutive weekends if allowed by the Sheriff's Department.  Huber privileges for work will be allowed if defendant can provide proof of employment.

miscConds.notes:
$730.00 payable to Pamela B. to be paid first.
To be paid second:  $7,323.49 to GE Capitol; $4,933.98 to Comenity Bank; $468.68 to Citibank; $3,168.07 Chase Coldwater Creek; $3,935.99 HSBC (Capitol One).

Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, DNA surcharge  and restitution.  Failure to pay will result in  a civil judgment.
Defendant to enter into a payment plan with agent and pay no less than $100.00 per month towards costs, fees, surcharges and restitution.  If revoked, to be paid through collectin by DOC from 25% of funds/wages.

Provide DNA sample, pay surcharge.
Court advised defendatn that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Participate and provide proof of gambling therapy.
Participate in Gamblers Anonymous if the defendant discontinues therapy.
Provide proof to agent of at least four (4) hours of credit counseling or financial counseling.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pamela Shead

records.addlTxt: Notice of Chapter 13 Bankruptcy Case - case summary received from email on 12/01/20 Bankruptcy case number 20-27232 Chapter 13 Bankruptcy filed 11/02/2020  All court cases include 2015CF001385 - $22,588.45.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count two.  Written Explanation sheet in file is marked "NOT"  as to eligibility for Challenge and Wisconsin Substance Programs.
Crime Victim Impact Statement with attached merchant list received and filed.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNTS 1 & 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

Defense counsel requested an adjourned sentencing date and will be filing a private sentencing memorandum. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  Bruce J. Landgraf on behalf of David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties are not prepared to proceed. Defense counsel requested an adjournment of the hearing to further review the restitution amounts with the defendant. Court granted defense request for adjournment. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be assigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.`  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  David Robles appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  All terms and conditions of bail continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court with attorney Gary Edward Rosenthal.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has retained Attorney Gary Rosenthal who is now the attorney of record.  Attorney Rosenthal indicated he and his client were prepared to proceed with a waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Indigency hearing proceeds.  Statements made by defendant.  Court ordered case set for status on counsel to allow defendant to continue to hire an attorney and continued case before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant appears without counsel.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   Court suspends the proceedings and orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Same Bail.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Pamela B and her address.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Pamela Shead in court with Cameron Weitzner, student inter practicing under the supervision of attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3/31/15 @ 1:30pm
